intro: Turnera dasytricha var. dasytricha, commonly known as the yellow flame plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Passifloraceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, including parts of Mexico and Central America. The plant is characterized by its vibrant yellow-orange flowers, which are typically borne in clusters along the stems. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a slightly hairy texture. This plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking appearance and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
